definition: to seek truth from facts (idiom)/to be practical and realistic

sentences.english: The facts indicate that in most cases, power still corrupts.
sentences.chinese: 實事證明，在大部分情況下，權力會使人腐敗。

sentences.english: However, Husserl's real fact is what appears to consciousness.
sentences.chinese: 胡塞爾的實事則是向意識顯現出來的一切。

sentences.english: “He can eat it when he comes in to the classroom, ” she said, very matter-of-factly.
sentences.chinese: “他可以進了教室再喫，”老師實事求是地說道。

sentences.english: Naturally measurements are only one part of the subwoofer evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 實事求是的說，測量參數也只是低音炮評估的一部分。

sentences.english: The dishonest, if they act honestly, get no credit.
sentences.chinese: 不老實的人，即使做了老實事，也得不到信任。

sentences.english: Serve the citizens in order of priority and urgency on practical affair, take the easiest the first .
sentences.chinese: 我們爲市民辦實事要分輕重緩急，先易後難。

sentences.english: According to the article, there is some difference between Aristole and Husserl, in the comprehension of the real fact.
sentences.chinese: 文章認爲在對實事的理解上，亞胡之間存在某些不同。

sentences.english: I honestly cannot think of any other variable that might be correlated with childhood intelligence than those already controlled for in the multiple regression analyses.
sentences.chinese: 實事求是的說，我個人無法想到任何其他的控制變量。

sentences.english: Not a false reputation, sarcasm disappear, do more practical work, honor.
sentences.chinese: 不圖虛名，譏諷隨之消失，多幹實事，榮譽不期而至。

sentences.english: Forming a good habit of doing more practical things with less empty talk.
sentences.chinese: 養成少說空話，多做實事的良好作風。

sentences.english: In the Tzu Chi Archive, there are many real life stories. One is about Mr.
sentences.chinese: 在慈濟大藏經裏面，有很多的故事，真人實事。

sentences.english: Being practical and realistic is the principle of using Li to explain the Book of Songs.
sentences.chinese: 以禮說《詩》應該遵循實事求是原則。

sentences.english: Unmentioned matters shall be addressed by both Parties through consultation with each other on the principle of seeking truth from facts.
sentences.chinese: 本合同未盡事項由雙方本着實事求是的原則協商解決。

sentences.english: They had to give a sober assessment of the situation.
sentences.chinese: 他們必須對情況做個實事求是的估量。

sentences.english: Article 47 The petition or complaint made by a public procurator shall be true to facts.
sentences.chinese: 第四十七條檢察官提出申訴和控告，應當實事求是。

sentences.english: As far as I know, none of their factual assertions have been refuted.
sentences.chinese: 就我所知，他們實事求是的言論沒有一條被人反駁。

definition: abreast of modern developments/to keep up with the times/progressive/timely
to prove a point/to expound on/to demonstrate or prove (through argument)/proof
to work industriously/to get things done
top priority job/matter of vital importance
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
conclusion/verdict/CL:個|个[ge4]/to conclude/to reach a verdict
as it should be by rights (idiom); proper and to be expected as a matter of course/inevitable and right
